inclusion.criterion: Subjects with metastatic brain tumors that were treated with stereotactic radiation (SRS)
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects with metastatic brain tumors which were not treated
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: tumor is located in the T-L spine, unresectable anaplastic astrocytoma s/p radiation

exclusion.criterion: glial tumor with no histological diagnosis
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: MRI showed a spinal cord conus mass which was biopsied and found to be anaplastic astrocytoma

exclusion.criterion: unable to lay still during the scanning
exclusion.label: unknown
does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: MRI showed a spinal cord conus mass which was biopsied and found to be anaplastic astrocytoma

notes: Patient's metastatic status is unclear, but given the presence of a spinal cord conus mass and unresectable anaplastic astrocytoma, it may be assumed that this is not a case of non-breast or lung metastasis. However, further clarification would be necessary to confirm.
